summary.span: 提供一个用于在 XHTML 标记中呈现移动控件的默认控件适配器。

span.span: Provides a default control adapter for rendering mobile controls in XHTML markup.

summary.span: 若要了解如何开发 ASP.NET 移动应用，请参阅 Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET (ASP.NET 移动应用和网站)。

span.span: For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此类提供基移动控件适配器，该适配器可在移动设备的 XHTML 标记中呈现控件及其每个子控件。This class provides a base mobile control adapter that renders a control and each of its children in XHTML markup for mobile devices. 它还提供派生 XHTML 移动控件适配器的帮助器方法和公共属性。It also provides helper methods and common properties for derived XHTML mobile control adapters. 控件适配器是替代某些 类方法和事件以允许特定于浏览器或特定于标记的处理的组件。Control adapters are components that override certain class methods and events to allow browser-specific or markup-specific handling. 呈现行为中的大部分适应性都封装在类中 。Much of the adaptability in rendering behavior is encapsulated in the class. 如果考虑是否生成自己的控件适配器，请记住，单个适配器可用于重写许多浏览器类行为。If you are considering whether to build your own control adapter, keep in mind that a single adapter can be used to override a number of browser class behaviors. 或者，通过在从类派生的类中包含所需的适应性 ，你可能不再需要使用控件适配器。Alternatively, by including the desired adaptability in a class derived from the class, you might eliminate the need to use a control adapter. 特定控件类的适配器适用于继承自该类的所有控件，除非存在更多的专用适配器。An adapter for a specific control class applies to all controls that inherit from that class, unless more specialized adapters are present. 例如， 类用于验证要求或可以显示 XHTML 标记的设备的所有移动控件。For example, the class is used to validate all mobile controls for devices that require or can display XHTML markup. 在处理过程中，.NET Framework 会截获对特定于当前目标的控件的方法的调用。During processing, the .NET Framework intercepts calls to the methods of a control that are specific to the current target. 如果控件适配器与控件相关联，则 .NET Framework 调用关联的适配器方法。If a control adapter is associated with the control, the .NET Framework calls the associated adapter methods. 控件的某些属性控制移动设备的多个辅助页面上显示的方式。Some properties of a control govern the way it displays across multiple secondary pages for a mobile device. 这些页面统称为 *辅助用户界面*。These page are collectively known as *secondary UI*. 属性可用于定义将显示的页面。The property can be used to define which page will be displayed. 方法可用于删除任何辅助 UI 设置。The method can be used to remove any secondary UI settings.

para.span: 从类继承时 ，请将给定控件类型和标记语言的适配器命名为模式 (例如 ) 。

span.span: When you inherit from the class, name your adapter for a given control type and markup language in the pattern (for example, ).

para.span: 提供 XHTML 标记的控件的适配器应在命名空间中实现 。

span.span: Adapters for a control that provides XHTML markup should be implemented in the namespace.

para.span: 应为配置 .browser 文件中每个设备节点下的专用控件定义专用适配器。

span.span: Any specialized adapters should be defined for the specialized control under each of the device nodes in the configuration .browser files.

para.span: 正确实现的控件不应假定附加了适配器，或者附加的适配器实现了特定的接口。

span.span: A properly implemented control should not assume that an adapter is attached, or that the attached adapter implements a specific interface.

para.span: 相反，它应检查这些条件。

span.span: Instead, it should check for these conditions.

para.span: 许多条件呈现方法允许将此类条件用作辅助 UI，而对于需要在每个块后面或每次内联控件之后需要换行的显示设备。

span.span: A number of conditional rendering methods allow for such conditions as secondary UI and for display devices that require line breaks after every block or after every inline control.

para.span: 这些条件方法的示例包括 和 。

span.span: Examples of these conditional methods are and .

para.span: 这些方法适用于给定设备，而不考虑要呈现的控件。

span.span: These methods work for a given device regardless of the control being rendered.

para.span: 创建基于此类的新控件适配器时，不太可能需要重写这些方法。

span.span: It is unlikely you would need to override these methods when creating a new control adapter based on this class.

para.span: 至少需要重写 方法。

span.span: At a minimum, you would need to override the methods.

para.span: 设备筛选需要使用特定的适配器进行服务器控件。

span.span: Device filtering is required to use a specific adapter for a server control.

para.span: 有关设备筛选的详细信息，请参阅自适应控制行为和[设备筛选概述](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/ms178620(v=vs.100))[的体系结构概述](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/67276kc5(v=vs.100))。

span.span: For more information about device filtering, see [Architectural Overview of Adaptive Control Behavior](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/67276kc5(v=vs.100)) and [Device Filtering Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/ms178620(v=vs.100)).

remarks.format:
## Remarks 如果目标设备需要在块级别元素（如）上中断 `
` ，则由指定的文本编写器 `writer` 会在开始呈现元素时设置挂起的分行符，并自动 `
` 在元素末尾) (呈现中断。If the target device requires breaks on block-level elements such as `
`, the text writer specified by `writer` sets a pending break when starting to render the element, and automatically renders a break (`
`) at the end of the element. 如果元素的内容超出设备上的一个逻辑页，则适配器将清除该页末尾的挂起中断。If the content of the element extends beyond one logical page on the device, the adapter clears the pending break at the end of the page. 此方法主要由 .NET Framework 在内部使用。This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework internally.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 只有在目标设备的极少数情况下才需要此功能，其中选定的元素不能出现在表中。This functionality is required only in the very rare case of a target device where a selected element cannot appear inside a table. 如果 `s` 提供了参数，则清除缓存的结束标记。If the `s` parameter is provided, the cached ending tag is cleared. 这允许文本编写器在目标设备不支持 `` elements immediately after the end of a table. 此方法主要由 .NET Framework 在内部使用。This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework internally.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果有挂起的中断，则会在开始链接标记之前呈现中断。If there is a pending break, the break is rendered before the opening link tag. 如果该 属性表示物理文件，并且目标设备不需要禁止显示级联样式表样式，则当前类名称将包含在呈现中。If the property represents a physical file and the target device does not require suppression of cascading style sheet styles, the current class name is included in the rendering. 如果 样式表的属性不表示物理文件，则 `tagName` 将在开始标记中应用适用于的控件的样式设置。If the property of the style sheet does not represent a physical file, style settings from the control that are appropriate for the `tagName` will be applied in the opening tag. 此方法主要由 .NET Framework 在内部使用。This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework internally.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法主要由自定义适配器的开发人员使用。This method is primarily used by developers of custom adapters.

para.span: 的基实现将 当前的辅助 UI 模式保存在视图状态中。

span.span: The base implementation of saves the current secondary UI mode in view state.

para.span: 您可以重写它以保存视图状态中的其他特定数据，但请确保从基类获取当前状态，然后将其与特定于控件的状态组合，以便跨请求保持辅助 UI 模式。

span.span: You can override it to save other specific data from view state, but be sure to obtain the current state from the base class, and then combine it with your control-specific state in order to preserve the secondary UI mode across requests.

para.span: 有关管理视图状态的详细信息，请参阅 [ASP.NET 状态管理概述](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/75x4ha6s(v=vs.100))。

value.span: 指示当前辅助用户界面模式的数字，由包含该模式的窗体确定。

span.span: A number indicating the current secondary UI mode, as determined by the form in which it is contained.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 辅助 UI 由显示用户界面的其他屏幕的控件使用。Secondary UI is used by controls that show additional screens of a user interface. 若要使用辅助 UI，控件适配器将执行以下步骤：To use secondary UI, a control adapter performs the following steps: 1. 在回发事件期间，控件适配器 在基类中设置属性 。During a postback event, the control adapter sets the property in the base class. 2. 在呈现时，控件将检查辅助 UI 模式，并呈现适当的辅助用户界面。In rendering, the control checks the secondary UI mode, and renders the appropriate secondary UI. 3. 为了响应用户与辅助用户界面的交互，控件适配器可能会将辅助 UI 模式更改为其他值，或者通过调用方法退出辅助 UI 模式 。In response to user interaction with the secondary UI, the control adapter might change the secondary UI mode to another value, or exit secondary UI mode by calling the method. 此属性主要由自定义适配器的开发人员使用。This property is primarily used by developers of custom adapters.
